required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Experience With a Pediatric Summer Intensive Therapy Program
clinical_study.official_title: The Experience of Participating in a Pediatric Summer Intensive Therapy Program--A Mixed Methods Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the lived experiences of children with neurodevelopmental diagnoses and their caregivers with an intensive model of therapy. Children will receive usual care during the summer intensive program and the investigators will access medical records to assess effectiveness. Children and caregivers will also be asked to participate in semi-structured interviews upon the completion of the episode of care.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the lived experiences of children with neurodevelopmental diagnoses and their caregivers with an intensive model of therapy. Research questions include: 1.) What are the perceptions of children and caregivers about intensive therapy after participating in multiple intensive therapy episodes over time? 2.) Why do caregivers choose to continue with an intensive model of therapy periodically for their child with neurodevelopmental diagnoses? 3.) What were the outcomes for children with neurodevelopmental disabilities participating in an episode of intensive therapy? Children will receive usual care during the summer intensive program and the investigators will access medical records to assess effectiveness. Children and caregivers will also be asked to participate in semi-structured interviews upon the completion of the episode of care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge assessed up to 10 days
primary_outcome.description: Upon completion of the program, children and caregivers will participate in an interview about their experience

primary_outcome.time_frame: measured at discharge 4 weeks after enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Lower extremity passive range of motion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at day 1 and discharge 4 weeks later
secondary_outcome.description: Measured at ankle, knee, and hip with goniometer

intervention.description: The intensive therapy program consists of physical therapy, occupational therapy, and speech therapy 3-6 hours x 4-5 days/week for 4 weeks. The individual therapies received will vary with the child/caregiver goals and be based on neuroplasticity and motor learning principles.

study_pop.textblock: Children 4-15 years old with neurodevelopmental diagnoses and scheduled for an intensive therapy program over the summer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children receiving therapy through the Children's Therapy Center's Tiger Intensive Program and their caregivers from May 24 to August 13 2021.
Exclusion Criteria:
- n/a

overall_contact.last_name: Jamie B Hall, PT, DPT, PhD

facility.name: University of Missouri Healthcare Children's Therapy Center
